pullRequest.body:
I'm constructing the homeomorphism between irrationals and Baire space using continued fractions, and found that names of declarations related to continued fractions are long.
This PR shortens them e.g.:
`GeneralizedContinuedFraction` -> `GenContFract`
`SimpleContinuedFraction` -> `SimpContFract`
`ContinuedFraction` -> `ContFract`
`GeneralizedContinuedFraction.denominators` -> `GenContFract.dens`
etc.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

This PR consists [Continued fractions makes an isomorphism between irrationals and baire space
](https://github.com/users/Komyyy/projects/3/) project

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### Import summary

No significant changes to the import graph

When this material was originally added, the names were actually acronyms like the ones you're introducing here, but @sgouezel recommended the longer names in use now: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/1433#issuecomment-530373969

Maybe as @semorrison suggested there you can use local abbreviations or notations? I personally am quite sympathetic to having shorter names though; to be honest the library files here are much easier for me to read with `GCF`, `SCF` etc. Would introducing abbreviations / notations next to the definitions (and then using them everywhere instead of the long "official" names) be a reasonable thing to do?

**edit**: I've created a Zulip thread for this PR [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2313210.20shorten.20names.20of.20continued.20fraction.20declarations).

:v: Komyyy can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9788213594/job/27025911754)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9788213594/job/27025911523)

I'd like to hear some additional opinions about what to do with the names in `NumberTheory.DiophantineApproximation`. (Though for now maybe just a TODO saying that the names aren't consistent is OK.) Other than that just some minor nitpicks.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion g.contsAux (n + 2) = ⟨gp.b * pred.a + gp.a * ppred.a, gp.b * pred.b + gp.a * ppred.b⟩ := by simp [*, contsAux, nextConts, nextDen, nextNum] ```

It's probably clearer to write this without an abbreviation, especially in the first sentence of the module docstring.
```suggestion
We show that the generalized continued fraction given by `GenContFract.of` in fact 
is a (regular) continued fraction. Using the equivalence of the convergents computations
```

This docstring is probably clearer without the abbreviation.
```suggestion
/-- The recurrence relation for the convergents of the continued fraction expansion
```

We may as well fix this typo while we're here:
```suggestion
`GenContFract.IntFractPair.stream` and `GenContFract.of` to wire up things. Users should not
```

```suggestion
/-- Returns the `GenContFract` of a value. In fact, the returned gcf is also a `ContFract` that
```

Trying to avoid unexplained abbreviations at the beginning of module docs:
```suggestion
# Recurrence Lemmas for the Continuants (`conts`) Function of Continued Fractions
```

```suggestion
Given a generalized continued fraction `g`, for all `n ≥ 1`, we prove that the continuants (`conts`)
```

```suggestion
# Equivalence of Recursive and Direct Computations of Convergents of Generalized Continued Fractions
```

```suggestion
direct evaluation (`convs'`)) for generalized continued fractions
(`GenContFract`s) on linear ordered fields. We follow the proof from
```

```suggestion
generalized continued fraction coincide at position `n` if the sequence of fractions contains
strictly positive values only.
```

For consistency with the `convergents` -> `convs` renaming in this PR, I'm tempted to suggest renaming `convergent` to `conv`. Thinking about it a bit more though, `conv` might be an overloaded abbreviation (e.g. we have `conv` mode). I guess for now we can leave these alone, but cc: @MichaelStollBayreuth in case he has any opinions.

Ah, I just noticed that `continued_fraction_conv_eq_convergent` and `exists_continued_fraction_convergent_eq_rat` don't seem to follow our [naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) (if I'm not confused they should have contained `generalizedContinuedFraction` somewhere in the name). Maybe this should just be mentioned in a TODO and left for a follow-up PR?

We shouldn't remain tech debts as possible.
I renamed `Real.convergent` to `Real.convs` & related theorems.

I'd actually prefer to keep `Real.convergent` as the name, as its meaning should be clear, whereas `Real.convs` is less so. (In the general continued fractions context, the (fully qualified) name includes a reference to continued fractions, so this is less of a concern, but here it does not.) Also, length of names is not really an issue in `Mathlib.NumberTheory.DiophantineApproximation` except for the few names referring to general continued fractions stuff (which obviously need to be consistent with the changes there). (The violation of the naming convention must be due to the port, I think.)
@MichaelStollBayreuth I have reverted the change about `Real.convs`, sorry.

Shouldn't this be
```suggestion
theorem genContFractConvs_eq_convergent (ξ : ℝ) (n : ℕ) :
```
to match the `convs`? Same comment for `exists_genContFract_conv_eq_rat`.

I think according to the [naming convention doc](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html#identifiers-and-theorem-names) (see the end of "Identifiers and theorem names"), if we include the namespace `genContFract`, it should be combined with the `convs` in lowerCamelCase. (I've edited the suggestion above accordingly.)

There's a case to be made that we could also leave out `genContFract` since `convs` is strictly speaking unambiguous, so I guess `convs_eq_convergent` might be OK as well, although maybe a bit harder to understand.
The doc-string mentions `GenContFrac`, so just `convs` should be OK.
I renamed.

Sorry, my earlier suggestion here may have been unclear since I edited it after I submitted it. If we keep the `genContFract`, then this should be 
```suggestion
theorem genContFractConvs_eq_convergent (ξ : ℝ) (n : ℕ) :
```
per the naming convention doc I mentioned in a later comment.

Alternatively, as Michael Stoll suggested, this shorter version could also work:
```suggestion
theorem convs_eq_convergent (ξ : ℝ) (n : ℕ) :
```

(And similarly for `exists_genContFract_convs_eq_rat` below.)

Anyways, once you pick one of these, feel free to merge!
bors d+
Ah, sorry. Maybe I should have been more explicit in my final comment. This theorem also should have been renamed to be consistent with `convs_eq_convergent`, so `exists_convs_eq_rat`.
(Resolved in #13555)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - style(Mathlib/Algebra/ContinuedFractions/*): shorten names of declarations related to continued fractions

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Mathlib/Algebra/ContinuedFractions/*): generalize determinant formula for continued fraction computation to simple continued fraction

Maybe as @semorrison suggested there you can use local abbreviations or notations? I personally am quite sympathetic to having shorter names though; to be honest the library files here are much easier for me to read with `GCF`, `SCF` etc. Would introducing abbreviations / notations next to the definitions (and then using them everywhere instead of the long "official" names) be a reasonable thing to do?
